foil.title: What is the Raspberry Pi?

listitem.para: A full-blown computer capable of running a desktop
Based on a different processor (brains) than a typical laptop or desktop
Is performant enough to be useful, but lower performance than a typical desktop, laptop, or high-end mobile device (expensive cell phones, tablets, etc)
Designed to make it easy to use with electronics projects

Created by a U.K. non-profit to make it easy and inexpensive to learn computing and electronics and especially the combination of those (including robotics) using a general purpose computer (i.e. not only for robotics and electronics)
This! (Show & Tell)

foil.title: What is the Arduino Uno?

listitem.para: A microcontroller plus support electronics for allowing programmitic control of both digial and analog electronic devices

The microcontroller and onboard flash (and RAM) allows the Arduino to run software to control hardware (aka firmware), but does not have enough resources to run most operating systems (including Linux)
As a consequence it generally operates a single program (called a sketch) at a time

It, however, can interface with a more powerful computer (include the Raspberry Pi) which can control what sketches run and when on the Arduino, and/or receive or send data from or to the Arduino for advanced processing and behaviours.
Comes preloaded with a number of 'libraries' and an interpreter for the "Processing" programming language, to make programming easier
OpenSource: the design of the Arduino is fully available so anyone can build their own Arduino, or modify and build a modified version (and share the results)
This: (Show & Tell)

foil.title: What can you do with it? (With sensors and output electronics)

listitem.para: Respond to sensors in complicated ways (e.g. detect patterns of light flashes and respond appropriately, temperature variations (or straight temp), temp + time (with the addition of an RTC), patterns of vibrations, etc)
Control motors/servos/actuators; especially useful for robotics, or building custom CNC devices
Control relays or variable speed devices
Interface with a Pi to handle the heavy-duty electronics, while the Pi handles higher-level logic
Capture and log environmental data
Capture and log seismic data
Be part of an alarm system, controlling and preprocessing IR, ultrasonic, sound, etc sensors
Much more...
